metadata.title: CVE-2020-12770 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.6.11. sg_write lacksan sg_remove_request call in a certain failure case, aka CID-83c6f2390040.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12770` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-185-generic - 4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-185-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-185-lowlatency - 4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-185-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-185-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-185-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-185-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-185-generic - 4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-185-lowlatency - 4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1074-aws - 4.4.0-1074.78
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1091-azure - 4.15.0-1091.101~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-185.215~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1074.78').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1091.101~14.04.1').
